General.Description: Litecoin is an open source software project licensed under the MIT / X11 license that allows you to run, modify, and copy software and to distribute, at your discretion, a modified copy of the software. This software is launched in a transparent process that allows independent verification of binary programs and their corresponding source code. The Litecoin LTC provides faster transaction confirmations (2.5 minutes on average) and uses a hardware-based hardware-based proofing algorithm to determine the target for normal and GPU computers. Everyone has had - that's the main difference for Bitcoin. The Litecoin network is planned to produce 84 million units of currency each year, having the same amount as bitcoin. The coin was generated by a Google employee, Charles Lee. Litecoin is in second place with Bitcoin and has produced countless clones - however, it has a solid support platform and dedicated development team.
General.Features: Miners are currently offering 25 new litecoins per block, which is reduced by half in about 4 years (840,000 blocks each). Therefore, the Litecoin network will produce 84 million liters, 4 times higher than Bitcoin. The Litecoin blockchain is capable of processing higher transaction volumes than its counterparts - Bitcoin. Due to more frequent volume creation, the network supports multiple transactions without modifying the software in the future. As a result, merchants receive faster confirmation time, while still being able to wait for further confirmation when selling larger items.
General.Technology: LTC includes much powerful technology such as faster transaction confirmations (2.5 minutes on average); Scrypt-based mining proof-of-work algorithm; Include 84 million litecoins; Have higher transaction volume than Bitcoin; MIT/X11 license.
General.Sponsor: Litecoin is a cryptocurrency that sponsored by SYMM. This is the investment fund trades and invests in ICOs.
